title: Bad personal credit , will this affect an LLC business ?
question: 5 years ago, i was unemployed so i lived off my credit for a while until i was even unable to do the minimum payment. i took a job overseas and now want to return back home. i will be joining a start up company as a partner and would like to know if i have my name on the company as an owner will the credit card companies be able to seize my assets in it ? will they be able to seize my salary ?
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Business debt,Debt collection for businesses,Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Business
answers: Your poor credit could affect the company's ability to get loans and credit, as most lenders and vendors rely on the credit of the principals of small businesses.

They must have judgement against you first. Your partnership interest may be at jeopordy later as an asset. But, this is costly and it will depend on how aggressive the CC company (or the company assigned) will want to be. Garnishment of a salary only comes after a debtor's hearing. But, if they have a judgement already, then execution can move fairly quickly. One further note, it sounds like Statute of Limitations may be in your favor as well. Please don't communicate with them, or offer settlement, until you discuss with an attorney. You might re-open discussions allowing to continue the statute. First, pull a credit report and figure out the damage and whether a judgement exit. Thsi will affect your new business only if you want to obtain a line of credit as personal guarantees are part of the business. No one is going to loan money to a LLC without a personal guarantee from all principals.

Only if they have sued you and obtained judgment(s) ... and you have not filed bankruptcy.
